snippet: A small number of Americans have offered to take up arms against the Islamic State, working with local militias in Iraq and Syria.
abstract: More than 100 Americans, many of whom are veterans, have traveled to Iraq and Syria to volunteer with local militias in battle against Islamic State militants; volunteers, who offer their services as riflemen and advisers, appear to be motivated by outrage over Islamic State's brutal acts, boredom with civilian life and eagerness to make use of their combat skills again.

byline.original: By DAVE PHILIPPS and THOMAS JAMES BRENNAN
byline.contributor: Dave Philipps reported from Austin, and Thomas James Brennan from New York. Kamil Kakol contributed reporting from Sulaimaniya, Iraq, and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: A small number of Americans have offered to take up arms against the Islamic State, working with local militias in Iraq and Syria.

headline.main: Unsettled at Home, Veterans Volunteer to Fight ISIS
headline.print_headline: Unsettled at Home, Veterans Choose a New Fight
